pull.title: wallet, migration: Fix empty wallet crash
pull.body:
Same as with a blank wallet (#28976), wallets with no legacy records (i.e. empty, non-blank, watch-only wallet) do not require to be migrated.

Steps to reproduce the issue:

1.- `createwallet "empty_wo_noblank_legacy_wallet" true false "" false false`
2.- `migratewallet`

```
wallet/wallet.cpp:4071 GetDescriptorsForLegacy: Assertion `legacy_spkm' failed.
Aborted (core dumped)
```

events.message:
wallet, refactor: Decouple into HasLegacyRecords()

The new helper will be used to fix a crash in the
wallet migration process (watch-only, non-blank,
private keys disabled, empty wallet - no scripts
or addresses imported).

Co-authored-by: Matias Furszyfer <mfurszy@protonmail.com>

events.body:
tACK d4cb6d048b0222cf51c8a56fa56f97dd5d2c9add

Changes look good to me and I confirmed that the new test fails on master.

events.message:
wallet, migration: Fix crash om empty wallet

Same as with a blank wallet, wallets with no legacy
records (i.e. empty, non-blank, watch-only wallet)
do not require to be migrated.

events.body:
ACK eb4333c8aa4a8f1a66ecbe5c48dbe15467332864

Tested that this fixes the issue in the PR description and also fixes another issue, #32112 (see https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/32112#issuecomment-2770913130). Reviewed and manually verified that the test case added here in `test/functional/wallet_migration.py` catches the issue in master. This refactor also improves readability of `LoadLegacyWalletRecords()`.

Concept ACK eb4333c8aa4a8f1a66ecbe5c48dbe15467332864

Suggested changes based on readability.

comments.body:
In 9962614b9060:

I changed my mind here. The blank flag check seems redundant and could even be harmful if it isn't unset after key import or creation for some reason. This could just be a:
```c++
success = empty_wallet;
```

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -445,6 +445,39 @@ def test_no_privkeys(self):
         # After migrating, the "keypool" is empty
         assert_raises_rpc_error(-4, "Error: This wallet has no available keys", watchonly1.getnewaddress)
 
+        # Migrating a watch-only blank empty wallet (with no pubkeys)
+        self.log.info("Test migration of a pure watchonly blank empty wallet (with no pubkeys)")
+        watchonly2 = self.create_legacy_wallet("watchonly2", disable_private_keys=True, blank=True)
comments.body: the `blank=True` flag is not needed when you disable private keys.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -445,6 +445,39 @@ def test_no_privkeys(self):
         # After migrating, the "keypool" is empty
         assert_raises_rpc_error(-4, "Error: This wallet has no available keys", watchonly1.getnewaddress)
 
+        # Migrating a watch-only blank empty wallet (with no pubkeys)
+        self.log.info("Test migration of a pure watchonly blank empty wallet (with no pubkeys)")
+        watchonly2 = self.create_legacy_wallet("watchonly2", disable_private_keys=True, blank=True)
+        # Before migrating
+        info = watchonly2.getwalletinfo()
+        assert_equal(info["descriptors"], False)
+        assert_equal(info["private_keys_enabled"], False)
+        assert_equal(info["blank"], True)
comments.body:
In https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/9962614b9060e9713042de91dc04ff5ea6604ae1:

The first check is redundant â€”`create_legacy_wallet()` already performs it. The other two checks are unnecessary. You want to verify migration here, not whether `createwallet()` works as expected, that's something different.

comments.body:
In https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/9962614b9060e9713042de91dc04ff5ea6604ae1:

This is actually asserting the wrong behavior. The migrated wallet should have private keys disabled, just like the legacy wallet.
Ok, I'll check, I've tested already that when you import an address the flag gets unset.

comments.body:
> The migrated wallet should have private keys **disabled**

Yes, it's doing that (private_keys_**enabled** = **False**), otherwise it would be failing.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -445,6 +445,39 @@ def test_no_privkeys(self):
         # After migrating, the "keypool" is empty
         assert_raises_rpc_error(-4, "Error: This wallet has no available keys", watchonly1.getnewaddress)
 
+        # Migrating a watch-only blank empty wallet (with no pubkeys)
+        self.log.info("Test migration of a pure watchonly blank empty wallet (with no pubkeys)")
+        watchonly2 = self.create_legacy_wallet("watchonly2", disable_private_keys=True, blank=True)
+        # Before migrating
+        info = watchonly2.getwalletinfo()
+        assert_equal(info["descriptors"], False)
+        assert_equal(info["private_keys_enabled"], False)
+        assert_equal(info["blank"], True)
+
+        _, watchonly2 = self.migrate_and_get_rpc("watchonly2")
+        # After migrating
+        info = watchonly2.getwalletinfo()
+        assert_equal(info["descriptors"], True)
+        assert_equal(info["private_keys_enabled"], False)
+        assert_equal(info["blank"], True)
+        self.assert_is_sqlite("watchonly2")
+
+        # Migrating a watch-only non-blank empty wallet (with no pubkeys)
+        self.log.info("Test migration of a pure watchonly non-blank empty wallet (with no pubkeys)")
+        watchonly3 = self.create_legacy_wallet("watchonly3", disable_private_keys=True, blank=False)
+        # Before migrating
+        info = watchonly3.getwalletinfo()
+        assert_equal(info["descriptors"], False)
+        assert_equal(info["private_keys_enabled"], False)
+        assert_equal(info["blank"], False)
+
+        _, watchonly3 = self.migrate_and_get_rpc("watchonly3")
+        info = watchonly3.getwalletinfo()
+        assert_equal(info["descriptors"], True)
+        assert_equal(info["private_keys_enabled"], False)
+        assert_equal(info["blank"], False)
+        self.assert_is_sqlite("watchonly3")
+
comments.body:
Could probably re-write this test in just a few lines:
```python3
self.log.info("Test migration of a watch-only empty wallet")
for is_blank in [True, False]:
    self.create_legacy_wallet("watchonly_empty", disable_private_keys=True, blank=is_blank)
    _, watchonly_empty = self.migrate_and_get_rpc("watchonly_empty")
    info = watchonly_empty.getwalletinfo()
    assert_equal(info["private_keys_enabled"], False)
    assert_equal(info["blank"], is_blank)
```

comments.body: I can see I got confused with other tests that validate it but I see they call `migratewallet` instead (and then `get_wallet_rpc` - I can do a follow-up to clean it up later). Same for `assert_is_sqlite`, I'll remove it, since `migrate_and_get_rpc()` already calls it within. Thanks!

comments.body: Yup, much better! Cheers!

This leaves the db batch object alive and could conflict with the `Flush()` and `DeleteRecords()` internals, as both access the db.

Better to limit the scope of the db batch object only to this function call.

You didn't change the behavior on the latest push. The `db_batch` object is alive **while** `Flush()` and `DeleteRecords()` are called. My suggestion was to scope each single `HasLegacyRecords()` call so it does not interfere with the other calls who also access db.
Yup, fixed it, thanks!
nit: I find this comment a bit redundant, especially in the tests. If you rename `db_batch` to `temp_batch` IMO it could be removed.

nit

```suggestion
//! Returns true if there are any DBKeys::LEGACY_TYPES records in the wallet db
```
Thanks! I'll overload `HasLegacyRecords` so it'd make it even cleaner I think.
Yeah, I'll tweak it a bit. Thanks!
extra ; at the end.
argh! Thanks!
Just a question: Why log the same message that gets thrown?

maybe this should be: 

```suggestion
        if (status == DatabaseCursor::Status::MORE)
```

as is done in [`WalletBatch::IsEncrypted()`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/1a6fc04d815e45ee895bd7ff0bc1b03685ed96c3/src/wallet/walletdb.cpp#L193-L202). That would more correctly handle `Status::FAIL` which I presume is extremely unlikely here.

Edit: And out of scope of this refactor commit, feel free to disregard, just an observation.
Because the caller is not logging it and didnâ€™t want to change the existing behavior in the refactoring commit, the `pwallet` argument could have otherwise been removed.
If it fails, we should abort the process. Probably by throwing an exception. But I would leave that for another PR to avoid mixing it with this crash fix.

The comment can be updated now to account for empty wallets as well.

```diff
-        // Do the migration of keys and scripts for non-blank wallets, and cleanup if it fails
+        // Do the migration of keys and scripts for non-blank and non-empty wallets, and cleanup if it fails
```
